task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 109°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current view faces the target building but the pitch is level; rotating upward will reveal the building's full height from ground to roof for accurate estimation.
The current heading (0°N) is facing north, but the target building is east at ~109°; rotating right by 109° will align the view with the building to observe its full height.
The view is aligned with the target building (109°E) but the pitch is level; rotating upward will reveal the building's full vertical extent for height estimation.
The current heading (0°N) is misaligned with the target building (109°E); rotating right by 109° will face the building directly to observe its height.
The view is correctly aligned with the target building (109°E) but the pitch is level; rotating upward by 30° will reveal the building's full height for estimation.
The current heading (0°N) is misaligned with the target building (109°E); rotating right by 109° will face the building directly to observe its full height.

The view is aligned with the target building (109°E) and previous upward rotations have revealed its full vertical structure; based on visual estimation of typical building proportions, the height is approximately 25 meters.
